### setAutoClaimResponsibilityForObjectSymbols() {#aa5fd9509ea64f5d3780326dea9b50424}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>RTDyldObjectLinkingLayer &amp; llvm::orc::RTDyldObjectLinkingLayer::setAutoClaimResponsibilityForObjectSymbols (bool AutoClaimObjectSymbols)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
If set, this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/rtdyldobjectlinkinglayer">RTDyldObjectLinkingLayer</a> instance will claim responsibility for any symbols provided by a given object file that were not already in the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/materializationresponsibility">MaterializationResponsibility</a> instance.

Setting this flag allows higher-level program representations (e.g. LLVM IR) to be added based on only a subset of the symbols they provide, without having to write intervening layers to scan and add the additional symbols. This trades diagnostic quality for convenience however: If all symbols are enumerated up-front then clashes can be detected and reported early (and usually deterministically). If this option is set, clashes for the additional symbols may not be detected until late, and detection may depend on the flow of control through JIT&#39;d code. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a> with care.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/rtdyldobjectlinkinglayer-h/#l00115">115</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/rtdyldobjectlinkinglayer-h">RTDyldObjectLinkingLayer.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### setNotifyEmitted() {#a237b2f36c0eb917c38e7a31cc4d25b45}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>RTDyldObjectLinkingLayer &amp; llvm::orc::RTDyldObjectLinkingLayer::setNotifyEmitted (<a href="#ad748c83b5f6db0f5d30bd2d537b142fb">NotifyEmittedFunction</a> NotifyEmitted)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Set the NotifyEmitted callback.

### setOverrideObjectFlagsWithResponsibilityFlags() {#ac4f7c81b37c4f8db5f4579cb667cb31a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>RTDyldObjectLinkingLayer &amp; llvm::orc::RTDyldObjectLinkingLayer::setOverrideObjectFlagsWithResponsibilityFlags (bool OverrideObjectFlags)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Instructs this RTDyldLinkingLayer2 instance to override the symbol flags returned by <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/runtimedyld">RuntimeDyld</a> for any given object file with the flags supplied by the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/materializationresponsibility">MaterializationResponsibility</a> instance.

This is a workaround to support symbol visibility in <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/coff">COFF</a>, which does not use the libObject&#39;s SF&#95;Exported flag. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a> only when generating / adding <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/coff">COFF</a> object files.

FIXME: We should be able to remove this if/when <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/coff">COFF</a> properly tracks exported symbols.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/rtdyldobjectlinkinglayer-h/#l00098">98</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/rtdyldobjectlinkinglayer-h">RTDyldObjectLinkingLayer.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### setProcessAllSections() {#ac3fa547646c5f32600aa7336df436ae5}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>RTDyldObjectLinkingLayer &amp; llvm::orc::RTDyldObjectLinkingLayer::setProcessAllSections (bool ProcessAllSections)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Set the &#39;ProcessAllSections&#39; flag.

If set to true, all sections in each object file will be allocated using the memory manager, rather than just the sections required for execution.

This is kludgy, and may be removed in the future.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/rtdyldobjectlinkinglayer-h/#l00084">84</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/rtdyldobjectlinkinglayer-h">RTDyldObjectLinkingLayer.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

ResourceManagers should perform book-keeping under the session lock, and any expensive cleanup outside the session lock.
